head: Dashboard
points: In the dashboard, you can view the total sales, total customers, and total profit.
Our user-friendly dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of key metrics
Making it easy to track and analyze your business performance
In the dashboard, you have access to real-time information on the latest orders, including order names, customer names, item details, order status, and amounts.
This streamlined view in a single window allows for efficient monitoring and management of your orders at a glance
points2: You Can see Latest 10 Performa Invoices in 'Latest Orders' table in Dashboard

head: Product & Service
points: To add Non Stock or Product Click the Product & Service in Dashboard.
Click the'Add Non Stock' button to add products to the  stock.
points2: Enter your Products Details in the form.
After entering  the details Click the 'Submit' button in the bottom right of the sceen
Now You Can see the Product in Table
points3: In table You Can 'view''Edit'Delete'and'update Non Stock' Options
For viewing the product Details Click on the 3 dot and Click 'view'
In view menu you can edit the product details and update Non Stock.
To edit the Produt details Click on the 'Edit' button and Change your details
To update the stock Click the 'update stock' button. and Enter yorur Stock
points4: From the Table itself You can update the stock
You can delete the product from the table by Confirming the menu after clicking the 'Delete' option

head: Sales
points: In table You Can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Sales Invoices
points2: Here you can create a new sales invoice using this button
points3: Add the complete details of the invoice and submit to create new sales invoice
points4: In this table you can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Proforma Invoices
points5: Here you can create a new proforma invoice using this button
points6: Add the complete details of the invoice and submit to create new proforma invoice
points7: In table You Can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Sales Credits
points8: Here you can create a new sales credit using this button
points9: Add the complete details of the sales credit and submit to create new sales credit

head: Purchase
points: The invoice date, invoice number, supplier total, and outstanding status of the goods are visible to us. We can also take action on the items. observe
points2: When the create invoice button is pressed, the fields invoice number, supplier name, leadger invoicedate, duedate, invoice items, and another button to add items appear. When this button is pressed, the fields product quantity, price, tax amount, INCtax, and discount in percentage discount amount of total amount are all displayed. All of this information can be seen with just one button pressed.
points3: We may view the invoice date, invoice number, supplier, total overdue status, and action for all fields in this field.
points4: Items that are visible on the debit notes page include the invoice date, invoice number, supplier, total, overdue balance, and status action.
points5: All the fields that are visible to us on the page are invoicedate and invoicenumber, supplier, total, overdue, status, and action.
points6: This page displays the fields, items, and actions that make up the fixed asset list.

head: Contacts
points: In the table You Can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Customers List
Here you can also add new customer using the add button on the top
points2: Add the complete details of the customer and submit to create new customer
points3: In the table You Can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Suppliers List
Here you can also add new supplier using the add button on the top
points4: Add the complete details of the supplier and press the save supplier button to create new supplier

head: Journals
points: In the table You Can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Journal List
Here you can also add new journal using the add button on the top
points2: Add the complete details of the journal and press the save  button to create new journal

head: Bank
points: We can view our current bank balance in the bank.
points2: Edit menu Their bank data are editable.
points3: Edit page: As you can see, we've added details. We've also checked, edited, and saved the details.
points4: We can view additional bank information.,
points5: We may view all columns and details in the table, including bank transaction dates, account types, and paid and received status actions.
points6: RECONCILE DEALINGS We are able to view the following fields: data particulars, reference account type, debit creation, date of reconciliation, status, and whether or not reconciliation has been completed. the transaction that is reconciled
points7: details area, where we are able to view the bank balance details.
points8: When edit is pressed, the edit page will display.
points9: edit page: we can change the bank account information we previously entered.

head: Cash
points: In this Page overall balance and the cash opening balance are shown
Here you can edit the cash management using the edit button given on the top of the card
Here you can also view all the transactions in cash using the view button on the to of the card
points2: In this Page you can add the complete details of the cash transaction and press the submit  button to create cash
points3: In the table you can 'View','Edit','Export','Search'and'Filter' Cash Transaction
Here you can also add the new cash transactions using more options button in the top
points4: In this page you can add all the receipt details and press the save button to add new receipt
points5: In this page you can add all the payment details and press the save button to add new payment
points6: In the pop up screen you can add all the payment details and press the save button to add new bank transfer

head: Report
points: Total revenue for the fiscal year amounted to [Amount], reflecting a [Percentage] increase/decrease compared to the previous year.
points2: GST is a similar consumption tax system to VAT, but it combines multiple taxes into a single tax levied on the supply of goods and services Like VAT GST is collected at each stage of the supply chain, with businesses adding GST to the price of their goods or services and remitting the tax to the government.
points3: A balance sheet is a financial statement that provides a snapshot of a company's financial position at a specific point in time, typically at the end of a reporting period such as a fiscal quarter or year. Here's a brief description of what it entails:
points4: Financial reporting involves the preparation and presentation of financial statements, including the income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement, and statement of changes in equity
points5: The primary purpose of a trial balance is to ensure the mathematical accuracy of the accounting records by verifying that debits equal credits.
points6: An unpaid purchase occurs when a company receives goods or services from a supplier but has not settled the outstanding invoice or bill for those goods or services.
points7: A stock summary provides a concise overview of a company's performance in the stock market, including key metrics and recent developments. Here's a brief description

head: Ledger
points: We can view all of the information in my ledger, including the nominal code, ledger account, category, category group, and status.
points2: When the visibility button is clicked, we can update the buy and sale records as well as the visibility journals.
points3: With the edit button pressed, the ledger can be edited.
points4: When we click add ledger, the ledger form with the fields' nomminal codes, categories, and categories group will appear.
points5: We can view all of the fields in the default ledger section, including the nominal code, ledger account, category, category group, and status.
points6: When the visibility button is pushed, the journals, buy and sales information, and updated visibility are displayed in this section.
points7: The user has the option to export all data to Excel or PDF.
points8: We can see the category name, category group action, and all of the tables and data in this section of my category.
points9: make a ledger category; in this part, the fields category and the category group are present.
points10: We have fields for the category group name in the default category section.
points11: The items pay headName, payhead type, ledger, and action are included in the pay heads section.

head: Payroll
points: Pay sheet with employee name, employee ID, phone number, email, compensation package, date of hire, and total earnings These fields are found in the pay sheet section.
points2: The page appears when the add button is pressed, and the create pay sheet page button is pressed.
points3: Paysheet pages provide information about employees, employee deductions, employee IDs, first and last names, phone numbers, email addresses, and wage packages.
points4: The employee section displays the employee's ID, complete name, email address, date of joining, and group designation.
points5: Add button is active. Employee page creation will appear on the page.
points6: make an employee form  this includes the phone number, flat number, and last name. This form includes the employee's basic information. this contains an employee's basic information

head: Proposal
points: Date, from, to, proposal, and action are all covered in the information in the proposals list.
points2: When the create button is pressed, a proposal page loads.
points3: create a proposal page with proposal details such as a contract to accept work such as tender work.
